pullRequest.body:
Given functors `L : A ‚•§ T` and `R : B ‚•§ T` and morphism properties `P`, `Q` and `W`
on `T`, `A` and `B` respectively, we define the subcategory `P.Comma L R Q W` of
`Comma L R` where

- objects are objects of `Comma L R` with the structural morphism satisfying `P`, and
- morphisms are morphisms of `Comma L R` where the left morphism satisfies `Q` and the
  right morphism satisfies `W`.

For an object `X : T`, this specializes to `P.Over Q X` which is the subcategory of `Over X`
where the structural morphism satisfies `P` and where the horizontal morphisms satisfy `Q`.
Common examples of the latter are e.g. the category of schemes √©tale (finite, affine, etc.)
over a base `X`. Here `Q = ‚ä§`.

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [18ac29cf5d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18088/commits/18ac29cf5de50c94967272fc90409f7cb40a1d42)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.MorphismProperty.Comma`|419|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Comma`
`+ Hom`
`+ Hom.Simps.hom`
`+ Hom.comp`
`+ Hom.ext'`
`+ Hom.hom`
`+ Hom.hom_mk`
`+ Over`
`+ Over.Hom.mk`
`+ Over.forget`
`+ Under`
`+ Under.Hom.mk`
`+ Under.forget`
`+ comp_hom`
`+ forget`
`+ forgetFullyFaithful`
`+ homFromCommaOfIsIso`
`+ hom_homFromCommaOfIsIso`
`+ id`
`+ id_hom`
`+ instance : (forget L R P Q W).Faithful`
`+ instance : (forget L R P ‚ä§ ‚ä§).Full`
`+ instance : Category (P.Comma L R Q W)`
`+ instance : MorphismProperty.IsMultiplicative (‚ä§ : MorphismProperty C)`
`+ instance [IsIso e] : IsIso e.left`
`+ instance [IsIso e] : IsIso e.right`
`+ instance [Q.RespectsIso] [W.RespectsIso] : (forget L R P Q W).ReflectsIsomorphisms`
`+ instance [Q.RespectsIso] [W.RespectsIso] {X Y : P.Comma L R Q W} (i : X.toComma ‚ü∂ Y.toComma)`
`+ instance {X Y : P.Comma L R Q W} (f : X ‚ü∂ Y) [IsIso f] : IsIso f.hom`
`+ inv_hom`
`+ inv_left`
`+ inv_left_hom_right`
`+ inv_right`
`+ isoFromComma`
`+ isoMk`
`+ left_hom_inv_right`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

I was also thinking about how to do `k`-Schemes and I don't think `Over` categories are the best way of doing it. 
But we will need this anyways to define etale sites etc.

Thanks!
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11492821881/job/31987506241)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11492821881/job/31987506688)

`ContainsIdentities` or `IsStableUnderComposition` are the sharper assumptions for the definitions `id` and `comp` above, but I would suggest using `IsMultiplicative` as a single assumption for the definition of the category instance.

Is this the right way around?
Or is this "subcategory of `Over X` defined by `Q` where morphisms satisfy `P`"

This is the subcategory of `Over X` where the structural morphisms satisfy `P` and for `X Y : P.Over Q X` a morphism from `X` to `Y` is a morphism `f` in `Over X` where `f.left` satisfies `Q`. Does this clarify it?
Oh then the original wording is right. I was just confused.

```suggestion
/-- Construct a morphism in `P.Over Q X` from a morphism in `Over X`. -/
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Comma): subcategory defined by morphism properties
